Dĩ An is a ward in Ho Chi Minh City of Southeast region of Vietnam. It is one of 168 new wards, communes and special zones in Ho Chi Minh City after the 2025 arrangement.
Geography
Di An  is roughly 18 kilometers northeast of Saigon Ward, and about 25 kilometers south of Binh Duong Ward and has the following geographical location:
* To the north, it borders Tân Đông Hiệp ward
* To the northeast, it borders Đông Hòa ward
* To the southeast, it borders Linh Xuan ward
* To the southwest, it borders Tam Binh ward
* To the west, it borders Bình Hòa ward
* To the northwest, it borders An Phú ward
As of July 1, 2025, with a population of 227,817 people as of December 31, 2024, Di An ward has become the ward with the highest population in Ho Chi Minh City and the highest in the country.
History
Di An Ward was formerly part of An Binh Commune, Di An District.
